Housekeeper NU:
If you’re passionate about being a part of a team that is, committed to the Team Member Experience and driven by innovation and growth, then join us! Health and Dental Benefits are available with no waiting period for successful candidates.

The Housekeeper is a critical role within our communities as it impacts the lives of residents and ignites the warmth of human connection.

As a Housekeeper your typical day will impact in the following ways:
Receiving assignment, assembling required materials and supplies, loading service cart and transporting to work area.
Performs resident room cleaning as per assigned schedule.
Performs cleaning and disinfecting duties such as sweeping, dry/wet mopping, vacuuming and rearranging furniture.
Ensuring privacy of residents during performance of duties.
Preparing room for new occupant following prescribed procedures to ensure tour ready at all times.
Notifying supervisor when supplies are low or equipment is malfunctioning.
Performing other duties as assigned.
Must Haves
Previous housekeeping experience is required.
Ability to read, write English and follow written instructions.
Good understanding of chemical and equipment use.
Ability to work independently or as a team.
Good understanding of chemical and equipment use.
WHMIS trained.
Strong customer service skills and ability to effectively communicate with residents and team members.
All applicants must successfully pass the prescribed Vulnerable Sector Check. Applicable to Ontario applicants.
All applicants must successfully pass the prescribed Criminal Records Check. Applicable to British Columbia applicants.
Act upon your desire to help others and Join Sienna Senior Living as we continue to enhance the lives of those we serve.

For Ontario locations, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act 2005, upon request, support will be provided for accommodations throughout the recruitment, selection and assessment process.

Stand for long periods of time

Financial Advisor - Okanagan Kootenay &:
The Financial Advisor Opportunity

We’re looking for dedicated people with an entrepreneurial spirit and an agile and proactive mindset who want to help Canadians achieve their financial goals. Perhaps you are considering a career change or, if you are currently in the industry, you are seeking an opportunity to improve outcomes for yourself and clients. Becoming a financial advisor with IG Wealth Management requires a high degree of dedication, commitment, and effort. For the right individual, combined with our support, this will be a highly rewarding career both personally and professionally. We are committed to excellence. Today, over 1,400 of our Consultants hold the CFP or F. Pl. designation, with a goal of having 100% of Consultants certified.

It’s a Rewarding Career And We Invite You To Explore The Opportunity We Offer

At IG Wealth Management, you build your practice on your terms – working directly with clients to develop relationships, provide comprehensive financial plans, and help them achieve financial confidence with their life-long financial goals.
Provide industry-leading training, support, and ongoing development throughout your career
Support you through a team of advanced financial planning experts and a network of wealth planning, mortgage, and insurance planning specialists
Offer exceptional income potential, where your earnings are reflective of your efforts.
Encourage independence and work-life synergy as you plan your schedule


About IG Wealth Management

Our goal is to be Canada’s financial partner of choice.
For more than 90 years, we have built meaningful, long-term relationships with our clients and their families. Our synchronized approach to financial planning looks at all aspects of a client’s financial life. We take the time to explore all the life goals, financial aspirations, and concerns clients have for themselves and their families, and then follow up with a comprehensive analysis of their overall financial well-being. We know that life is dynamic, so we assess and adjust client plans as their circumstances change. This approach enables them to take advantage of the possibilities that life brings and helps them realize their full financial potential. Today we deliver financial planning and wealth advice to more than one million Canadians coast to coast through our network of financial advisors.
Management/Sales Trainee:
La Description

Bienvenue chez Sherwin-Williams

Sherwin-Williams est la plus grande entreprise de peinture au monde. Avec un chiffre d’affaire de 15.8 milliards de dollars, plus de 4,100 magasins et 140 centres de production et de distribution dans le monde entier. Nos 60,000 salariés à travers le monde sont diversifiés, innovants et passionnés. Avec une variété d’opportunités stimulantes et enrichissantes, Sherwin-Williams est l’endroit pour démarrer une carrière. Trouvez la vôtre et rejoignez-nous aujourd’hui.

Si vous pensez avoir ce qu’il faut pour être un expert, un formateur, un analyste, pour résoudre efficacement les problèmes ou tout simplement un bon leader, vous pouvez faire partie de l’équipe de gestion Sherwin Williams. Notre programme de formation en Gestion est conçu pour vous fournir toutes les connaissances nécessaires pour vous bâtir une belle carrière en gestion ou en vente.

Notre programme de formation en gestion inclus des modules d’autoapprentissage, de la formation structure sur le terrain, des cous en classe à notre centre de formation de même qu’une éducation continue tout au long de votre carrière. Votre formation couvrira tous les aspects de la gestion de magasin, incluant la peinture, les produits associés, le service à la clientèle, les ventes professionnelles et marketing, crédit et gestion des comptes recevables, gestion des ressources humaines, gestion des profits et pertes et de la mise en marché.

Après avoir compléter le programme de formation, vous serez aptes à progresser au travers de plusieurs positions en gestion d’un magasin de peinture. Nos assistants de magasins et gérants de magasins gèrent des magasins d’un millions de dollar, fournissant du leadership et des connaissances approfondies dans les stratégies de développement de leur magasin.

Plusieurs Stagiaires en gestion choisissent une voie qui mène à une carrière dans la vente. Les Professionnel(le)s de la vente de Sherwin-Williams accroissent la part de marché de la compagnie en vendant à des clients commerciaux, tel que les entrepreneurs peintres, les acheteurs, les manufacturiers et autres clients commerciaux qui nécessitent un gros volume de nos produits de haute qualité. Généralement, les Professionnel(le)s de la vente appliquent leur expertise sur des territoires spécifiques. Les Stagiaires en gestion sont éligibles aux postes de Professionnel(le)s de la vente lorsque leur réussite en magasin a été établie.

Exigences De Base
Doit posséder un permis de conduire valide.
Doit posséder un Baccalauréat d’une université accréditée ou en obtenir un dans les 12 prochains mois.
Doit être légalement autorisé(e) à travailler dans le pays d’embauche sans parrainage pour visa d’emploi.
Doit pouvoir récupérer du matériel sur des tablettes ou des piles sur le sol et transporter jusqu’à 50lbs
Doit pouvoir teinter de la peinture, donc doit avoir une bonne perception de la couleur
Doit pouvoir opérer un ordinateur et communiquer par téléphone.
Exigences Souhaitées
Expérience précédente en vente ou service à la clientèle.
Volonté de relocalisation pour opportunités de promotion.
Le bilinguisme serait un atout.
Joignez-vous au programme de formation qui vous servira de tremplin pour toutes vos aspirations professionnelles.

Qui sommes nous;

Chez Sherwin-Williams, nous sommes fiers de notre famille d’employés loyaux. Pour en connaître davantage sur notre compagnie et notre culture visitez le Sherwin.com/careers .

Employeur souscrivant au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploiTous les candidats qualifiés seront considérés pour le poste et pour l'emploi et ne seront pas victimes de discrimination fondée sur la race, la couleur, la religion, le sexe, l'orientation sexuelle, l'identité sexuelle, la nationalité, le statut de vétéran protégé, le handicap, l'âge, la grossesse, l'information génétique ou toute autre considération interdite par la loi ou le contrat.
Part Time CAREGiver to Seniors - Kelowna:
At Home Instead caring is our passion – and it starts with our CAREGivers .

Every day families are balancing what feels like a thousand requests, needs, and demands. Many are raising children, working stressful jobs, AND caring for a senior family member. Advances in medicine and healthier lifestyles help seniors live longer and continue to lead more productive lives. But the numbers tell a deeper story: children of seniors who need day-to-day assistance are caught between being an involved, loving parent; a dedicated employee; and a devoted caregiver to the seniors they love. These family caregivers eventually run out of hours in the day and the stress can overcome even the most giving.

That’s where you come in.

As a CAREGiver, your job will be to help the senior thrive in their home. By doing that you will also help their children to restore balance, order, and peace to their lives. Caring for seniors is a labour of love that requires a special person with just the right touch. That’s why when you provide care with our Home Instead Senior Care office, you become a CAREGiver with a capital “CARE”.

Becoming a professional CAREGiver is a unique job with many joys and rewards, responsibilities and challenges – both physical and emotional. As a Home Instead CAREGiver you’ll meet wonderful people, build fulfilling relationships, and make a difference in the lives of seniors in your community.

Important Information
No experience or medical skills necessary, we focus on finding amazing people and developing the skill set necessary
Variable shifts
Availability to 15 hrs or more per week. (days, evenings and overnight plus either a Saturday or Sunday)
CAREGivers require their own personal vehicle and driver's license with no restrictions. We service from Penticton to Lake Country


What We Offer
Competitive Wages
Benefits package available
Ongoing paid training and education opportunities
A support team in the office 24/7
Recognition of the important work you do.
A fun and rewarding career!
